title: How to find the value of x³ +7x² -x +16 when x= 1+2i - Quora

response.answer_text: Answer: Value of the expression = -17 + 24i Solution: To find the value of the expression f(x) = x³ +7x² -x +16 …………………………………………………………………………..……(1) Given x = 1+2i . Substituting in (1), f(x) = (1+2i)³ + 7(1+2i)² - (1+2i) +16 ………………………………………………………..(2) We have the formulae, (a+b)³ = a³ + 3a²b + 3ab² + b³ and (a+b)² = a² + 2ab + b². Taking a = 1 and b = 2i, (2)→ f (x) = [1³ + 3.1².2i + 3.1.(2i)² + (2i)³] + 7[(1² + 2.1.2i + (2i)²] - (1+2i) + 16 =(1 + 6i + 3.4.i² + 8i³) + 7(1 + 4i + 4i²) -1 -2i +16 =1 + 6i + 3.4.i² + 8i³ +7 +28i +28i² -1 -2i +16 =8i³ +12i² +28i² +6i +28i -2i +1+7–1+16 (Collecting like terms) Or, f(x) = 8i³ +40i² +32i +23 …………………………………………………………………(2) We know from Theory of Functions of Complex Variable that i is the imaginary unit of the complex number a+bi and the basic property of the complex number i is i² = -1 and i³ = i².i = -i Substituting the above values of i² and i³ in (2), f(x) = -8i -40 +32i +23 = 24i -17 (After simplification) ∴The value x³ +7x² -x +16 when x = 1+2i is: -17 +24i
